DOC.brief_summary: Brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF), originally known to be a member of the nerve growth factor family, has aroused attention as a modulator in visceral hyperalgesia recently. Visceral hypersensitivity is recognized as a clinical hallmark in IBS patients. So in this study, the investigators will focus on the role of BDNF in colonic hyperalgesia in IBS patients.
DOC.brief_title: Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor Participates in Visceral Hyperalgesia in Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnosed with irritable bowel syndrome. Patients have similar clinical symptoms as IBS, yet there is morphologic changes in the intestine.
